qas.question: In what century did Nimbarka live?
How many categories of existence are there in Dvaitadvaita?
What are the categories of existence in Dvaitadvaita?
Who is named as the highest entity worshiped in Dvaitadvaita?
Who is not worshiped in Dvaitadvaita?

context: Dvaitādvaita was proposed by <a0_0>Nimbarka<a0_0/>, a <a1_0>13th-century<a1_0/> Vaishnava Philosopher from the Andhra region. According to this philosophy there are <a2_0>three<a2_0/> categories of existence: <a3_0>Brahman, soul, and matter<a3_0/>. <b9_0>Soul and matter<b9_0/> are different from Brahman in that they have attributes and capacities different from Brahman. Brahman exists independently, while <b5_0>soul and matter<b5_0/> are dependent. Thus soul and matter have an existence that is separate yet dependent. Further, Brahman is a controller, the soul is the enjoyer, and matter the thing enjoyed. Also, the highest object of worship is <a4_0><b6_0><b8_0>Krishna<b8_0/><b6_0/><a4_0/> and his consort Radha, attended by <b7_0>thousands<b7_0/> of gopis; of the Vrindavan; and devotion consists in self-surrender.
